instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PM_SYSRST_L: What is PM_SYSRST_L? PM_SYSRST_L is a system reset signal present when it is low, _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be high for the system to exit reset mode & turn on properly. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Good morning, this mac had 1V on the PPBUS, I checked the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> terminals 27/28 had high resistance, then I changed the resistors and the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, the PPbus is now 12.56V, but the mac won't turn on.


Voltage:
PPBUS 12,56V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,39V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> 0,021V
<SIGNAL>PM_SYSRST_L</SIGNAL> 0V;
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> 0V, pulse 100mV
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> 0V, no pulse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?
Be aware, this board only turns on with 85W charger, if no battery connected.
Check <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 3,34V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3,34V
I am using 85W charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> comes high when pressing power button?
Check for pulse at least.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 76923, member: 682"]
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> comes high when pressing power button?
[/QUOTE]
Yes, this is exactly what happens.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Does it stay high, or just pulse???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> gets 3,34V only when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered.

Sometimes it turns on when it is tested on battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Try to start in SMC byapss mode.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
17/18 3,5Ohm 2728 20Ohm 
does not accept SMC Bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Once power button is released, <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> disappear immediately?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 76977, member: 682"]
Once power button is released, <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> disappear immediately?
[/QUOTE]
This is exactly what happens.
This test is only possible with the battery connected.
There is a strange sound coming from the PCH.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: When trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, do you catch any pulse at L7520, or other big coil?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: The only coil that pulses are L7560, it gets loud when you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Pulsing at L7560???
Didn't say stable <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> in some previous post?
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3,34V"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE = "2informaticos, post: 77014, membro: 682"]
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3,34V"
[/CITAR]
DESCULPE.
L7195 5,5v
L7520 0v, SEM PULSO QUANDO ACIONA <SIGNAL>SMC_ON0FF</SIGNAL>
L7560 3,34v
L7310, L7320, L7320, L7870, L7630 0V, SEM PULSO QUANDO ACIONA <SIGNAL>SMC_ON0FF</SIGNAL>
L7130 12,47v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> pulses when you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?
You should note a drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> 0V, no pulse when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> is triggered.

<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> starts high at 3.39V, when triggering the <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> drops 0.127V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Reball/change the SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
I replaced the SMC, in tests it showed the image, but when I turned the mac off and on again, it didn't turn on again. I would try a Bios, when I applied voltage to the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, it was shorted.
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_LL</SIGNAL> shows 0.002 Ohm. The PCH gets hot when I apply voltage to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: PCH is now fried, change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Why did this happen?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Always hard to understand your english.
"I applied voltage to the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, it was shorted"
Was there short before injecting voltage?

"<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_LL</SIGNAL> shows 0.002 Ohm"
Did you check that before injecting voltage?
